As we begin a new year in a new way, it is important to keep you informed about the health and safety of our students. We have and will most likely continue to have students and staff test positive for Covid-19. There is no doubt about that. What we can assure you is we are taking each and every step recommended by the CDC and Alabama Department of Public Health to isolate and/or quarantine any person testing positive or suspected of having Covid-19. Our alternating schedule is a step we are taking to allow for proper social distancing. It is our hope that in the event we have a person test positive, these steps will, first and foremost, provide a layer of protection from infection, and prevent a widespread need to isolate otherwise healthy students.

If you have any questions or concerns we encourage you to contact your child's school. We understand the concern and we are here to help.

--
Michael D. Smithart
Superintendent
Opp City Schools

Parents, please see below for a message from Dr. Mackey, Alabama State Superintendent of Schools.

The Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE) has partnered with the University of Alabama to conduct a statewide school technology survey.
